properties.headline: Low Water Advisory issued February 6 at 4:07AM CST until February 6 at 9:00PM CST by NWS Houston/Galveston TX
properties.description:
* WHAT...For the Low Water Advisory, abnormally low water levels
expected. For the Small Craft Advisory, northwest winds 20 to
25 knots. Bay waters rough.

* WHERE...Galveston Bay.

* WHEN...For the Low Water Advisory, from 9 AM this morning to 9
PM CST this evening. Low Tide at Manchester is at 12:37pm today. For
the Small Craft Advisory, until 6 AM CST early this morning.

* IMPACTS...Below normal water levels will result in hazardous
navigating conditions. Conditions will be hazardous to small
craft due to the strong winds.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...For the Low Water Advisory, low tide this
afternoon will be much below normal, around -1.0 to -1.5 feet
below Mean Low Level Water (MLLW). At around one foot below
MLLW, areas of bare ground begin to appear in the upper reaches
of the ship channel. Once we get to around two feet below MLLW,
then bare ground begins to appear around Morgan's Point and
Manchester. For the Small Craft Advisory, winds will remain
moderate through the afternoon, so caution flags will be issued
from the time this advisory expires until 6 pm this evening.
properties.instruction:
Inexperienced mariners, especially those operating smaller
vessels, should avoid navigating in hazardous conditions.

Mariners should navigate shallow waters with extreme caution due
to below normal water levels.

NWSheadline: SMALL CRAFT ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM CST EARLY THIS MORNING... ...LOW WATER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM THIS MORNING TO 9 PM CST THIS EVENING
